item.description:
Kenneth Reitz is the author of many popular Python documentation projects and libraries, including:

  • requests: HTTP for humans
  • Hitchhiker's Guide to Python
  • Tablib: Pythonic Tabular Datasets
  • Legit: Awesome Git interface
  • OSX-GCC-Installer: Angers Lawyers
  • Clint: Command-line interface toolkit
  • Envoy: subprocess for humans
  • Httpbin.org: requests and response service

Kenneth is also the self-proclaimed "Python Overlord" for Heroku, a platform-as-a-service (PaaS).

He's going to be giving a quick interactive crash course on deploying Python applications to Heroku.

Don't miss his Python for Humans talk at the Boston Python meetup on May 21st (two days before his talk at the Django meetup).

Parking

Parking is always a little tricky but the garage near our office is the best option -Â  Cambridge West Garage in Cambridge Center off Ames Street. The road is technically called Ames place although it does not show up on some GPS. The garage is under the new construction happening near our building. You can't miss the giant crane.

Sponsors

Thanks to Akamai for hosting this meetup and providing the food! Check out their job openings page if you're looking for a new opportunity.
item.how_to_find_us: Akamai will host the meetup in their Executive Conference rooms.
item.name: Heroku 101 with Kenneth Reitz
